Reviews.Title: “Chic Design for a Steal.”
Reviews.Author: tyleranneliese
Reviews.Content: We we're lucky enough to escape from Cancun to Playa for Basico's buy 3 nights for 2 deal-- what an amazing spot to meet locals, explore the beaches, and just veg-out on the roof. Fish of the day is always fresh and breakfasts always hit the spot after long nights at Bar Ranita. Kinky polaroid camera chained to the bed if you want to pay 450 pesos for film. I miss the beds and funky decor. Do not miss the shower or water temp/pressure issues. WE WILL COME BACK ASAP! If you can't handle the nightlife noise, the windows block out most of it, but quiet retreat this place is not during 7-3am. Thanks to all the staff, sign the guestbook and use that great anise-exfoliant soap.

Reviews.Title: “Nice design, but not a relaxing place to stay...”
Reviews.Author: Beachlovers88
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a few days. It is right in the middle of the busiest street in town, there is an open air bar/club across the road from the entrance and another in front. If you are outside your room all you can hear is a thumping of music from 2-3 different clubs... which doesn't make for a relaxing stay. I think due to the noise issues they have recently sound proofed the rooms, but not great if you like some fresh air as you need to sleep with air con on and doors closed to avoid the loud music. Even with the doors closed you can still hear the bass. Postives are that it is an interesting design, the patio room is small with no proper separate bathroom (shower is in the room itself with just a curtain), but that is okay for short stays and you most likely won't be in your room that much and hopefully enjoying the beach. Negative is that front desk staff should not be trusted - we had two incidents, one where we found front desk staff taking cash kickbacks from agents across the street who rented us a car. We ended up overpaying for the car and found out that we overpaid as agent was taking a large commission and front desk staff was also taking a commission. Car was recommended by the front desk. Also check your bill thoroughly upon checking out, we found that items had been placed on our bill - food and drinks that we didn't consume, and whomever did this had forged our signature, must have been staff involved as no one else would know how my signature should look. So please check the bill thoroughly upon check out. I wouldn't come back here to stay, nice to see, but think there are probably more relaxing places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: Claire C
Reviews.Content: Hotel Basico belongs to the Design Hotel chain which is a well selected group of boutique hotels for their unique design aesthetic and standards. The staff here are very friendly, super cool and professional. They were patient enough to persevere with me if I was in the mood to practice my Spanish but also happy to switch to English whenever I gave up. The rooms are quite different from the normal hotel fanfare (check out the website) and have a kind of party feel to them. The bar on the rooftop is also worth a visit whether you stay at the hotel or not. Organise a little party of friends to really make the most of it.

Reviews.Title: “A Hotel to Lust After”
Reviews.Author: Mediterranean_Girl
Reviews.Content: A polaroid camera chained to the bed. A shower in the bedroom. Hot pink neon lighting. A magazine called "Animal" on the nightstand. This, my friends, is Hotel Basico, the stuff of dreams -- that is, if you ever wished to fall asleep. Couples must find these rooms to be intoxicating temples of modernist passion, with the elevated platform bed serving as an altar devoted to hedonist pleasure. But sadly, I stayed here solo, and wished the entire time that I wasn't. Not that I didn't have the most perfect stay, in every way. As a matter of fact, it is my favorite hotel I have ever stayed in, and if you tell me you slept in my "Claudia" room on the corner, I would be fiercely jealous. There are personal inner tubes and soccer balls to take to the beach on a whim. Two circular pools adorn the industrial space on the roof, inviting you to pleasure yourself in both. Breakfast is a plate of local fresh fruit, juice, coffee, and toast, and when I asked for milk for my coffee, it was served warm, without my asking. Hotel Basico is in the heart of the tourist action, but only a short walk from authentic Mexican restaurants catering to locals ike El Sarape and El Fogon. There's a taxi station 10 feet from the hotel's outdoor lobby, and Colectivo and the main bus station are just a few blocks away. Playa del Carmen (and Mexico, for that matter) is one of the safest places I've visited in many years. The rooms have recently been sound-proofed, and you can keep the fan on at all times, so the music at night is barely audible. Still, a pair of ear plugs and half an ambian aren't a bad idea to ensure a perfect night's rest. Stay at an all-inclusive resort if you wish to be boring, but bring the hottest partner you can find if you want to live life on the Hotel Basico edge. And when you get there, tell Claudia I miss her badly.

Reviews.Title: ““Truly for the younger generation.””
Reviews.Author: KarlawhiteNY
Reviews.Content: I must admit that is the most fun/strange/modern hotel if you going to Riviera Maya. Also it is a block from the beach. But if you want to sleep get a room away from the pool area and the noise at night. The service was great, friendly and attentive.

Reviews.Title: “What an amazing place, I'd go back in a heartbeat”
Reviews.Author: GSea
Reviews.Content: We came to Playa on the first week of our honeymoon last year, we were blown away. Basico is one of the most amazing places to stay, the design is inspirational and the staff are wonderful. I don't know what we had expected, but whatever we did was truly supassed by what Basico had for us, I loved the room, everything down to the lighting is designed in a quirky and modern way somehow including original mexican aspects as well. I loved the food. Loved the bar with it's trendy oldschool mexican wrestling films projected on the wall and hammocks to chill in. There is also an amazing beach club called 'Canibal Royal' which is associated with the hotel so you get passes to go there, this place is NOT to be missed, it's another design haven with quirky 50's and 60's design meeting traditional mexican style. A-Mazing, I only wish we could go back every year. I would advise going out of season for better prices and a better nights sleep, we were there end of September and one night was a party night, this is pretty loud in the rooms, but we didn't mind really.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, trendy hotel”
Reviews.Author: lirits
Reviews.Content: This something like a "design boutique hotel" (my description) it has few rooms in a perfect location for visiting Playa del Carmen. Just a block away of the beach and night life. The rooms are very cook designed. They reused ship elements for decoration and as its name says "Basico" means basic which means that all the plumbery is outside the walls as decoration, a huge bed in the center of the room with drawers, boxes, luggage keepers, etc under it. What I didn't like was that the room's smell was bad, there was water leaking in the bathroom, the WC was not working properly, one light was not working, the electric plug in the bathroom wasn't working. Sometimes there wasn't hot water in the shower/tub. All this was eventually fixed but my first reaction is that this hotel/price is not worth it if they can't even check this small details.

Reviews.Title: “loved the restaurant”
Reviews.Author: julestravels2
Reviews.Content: We read about the restaurant at the Hotel Basico in one of our travel guides and we're glad we gave them a shot! Great location in the middle of the Playa tourist area with views of la Quinta. The overall vibe of the building is very hip, Miami-esque, and modern, but somehow the family feel of the restaurant shines through. we were at one of only two occupied tables at the time, so we could see the ladies in the kitchen working hard to create fresh, delicious seafood dishes for us. Personal touches from the chef made the dishes her own unique creations. We tried the crab empanadas, shrimp in chile water (like a ceviche), and garlic style fish of the day, which was a whole fried grouper. They all tasted like they were caught that morning. We could still taste the sea, which is quite an improvement over frozen seafood normally available in the midwest. The service was very friendly. Margaritas from the bar upstairs were great!

Reviews.Title: “Stylish But Uncomfortable”
Reviews.Author: boutiquelover14
Reviews.Content: Really liked the look of the place, having seen it in various guides and websites. It is clear though that more thought has been put into the design than the functionality of the hotel. The roof top bar was so noisy till quite late and this filtered down to the rooms below, making it impossible to sleep until the bar closed. Not great if you don't want to stay up late which over a 5 night stay, sometimes we didn't.

Reviews.Title: “Ultra cool design. Go to an inclusive chain if you don't get it.”
Reviews.Author: CocoFranco
Reviews.Content: Based on the reviews below, I can't beleive peoples' expectations of hotels. This hotel is amazing from a design perspective. It's beautifully appointed and a joy to look at and stay at. I think as Playa Del Carmen grows closer to becoming another Cancun, it invites boring, unimaginative Americans who belong elsewhere rather than an ultra hip and interesting hotel. Do yourself a favor, if you expect so much from a couple hundred dollars a night, stay at a major chain hotel that caters to your straighforward tastes. Otherwise, do something different, appreciate the artists that have striven to create the atmosphere at Basico, stop complaining and enjoy Mexico. Enough already.

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel, nice staff, but couldn't stay here.”
Reviews.Author: Scout99Seattle_WA
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located in Playa del Carmen, close to the beach, restaurants and fun things. The staff was friendly. But the idea of staying at this hotel for a week was not palatable. The rooms were just a little too basic. Not nearly enough room to store your clothes, not a single flat surface upon which to set you coffee or drink glass. No bedside table...etc. We were originally checked into a room overlooking the courtyard but felt it provided insufficient privacy. The floor to ceiling windows were not completely covered by the curtains. We advised that the room would not work to us and they upgraded us for free to a city view room. But again, no furniture, and curtains that didn't close. How do you keep the sun out in the morning? Where do you set your coffee cup? I guess this hotel was just not a good match for us. We ended up leaving and checking in to a different hotel nearby. The staff was gracious and facilitated our move without issue. We have walked by the hotel several times during our stay and appears all of the rooms are empty.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing BASICO”
Reviews.Author: natmac86
Reviews.Content: Congrats to basico hotel!!! Really good choice to stay in. The rooms were amazing and original, the staff was brilliant Even though it was a bit noisy at night it gives a certain charm to hotel!!! We would def go back whenever we visit playa del carmen.

Reviews.Title: “Trust us...you will be GREATLY DISAPPOINTED”
Reviews.Author: hmholliday
Reviews.Content: Bullet points seem to be easier to read: Starting with the good... - Very cool website, makes hotel look amazing - The manager of the hotel was very sweet and friendly, welcoming, helpful - Really cool location, on main strip, a block from beach - Starbucks RIGHT ACROSS THE STREET! Now for the truth... - Switched rooms three times and each of them smelled absolutely horrible - Sea View room that week paid $100 more for was not a sea view room as over 1 1/2 years ago a hotel was built that blocks the view of the sea, yet was still advertised as a sea view room - Toilet paper missing in room and was asked for multiple times yet was not given to us - No comforter in two of the rooms we stayed in and was asked for multiple times - Floor to ceiling sliding doors did not open as they were rotted - Water was not hot, and was only luke warm for literally one minute then turned freezing cold - Drains did not drain well - Doors in sea view room did not lock, we asked the front desk multiple times to take a look at it and fix it as the night before we had someone try to get into our room at 3am, and they said it is fixed yet it never was fixed - The manager and one other employee were the only two friendly people we encountered of the hotel staff - Pools on top of the hotel looked un-kept, grosse Overall we were extremely disappointed with the hotel... Just wanted to share with you so you wouldn't end up disappointed like we did

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: Charliej81
Reviews.Content: The hotel was ok. Nice location, 5th avenue. Good food. Nice staff. About the noise, it is not loud, you can sleep with no problem. I booked this hotel to have the experience with my wife having that street view from the bed. It is very exciting, but there is too much light from the street, we needed to partially close the curtains, it could be much better if the windows were tinted (one way view windows). If you doubt about if your partner will like the hotel, you should not book this hotel without her knowledge. Dirty windows. Evevator out of service. No hot water. No help with baggage. The safe box is not really a safe. Too much rubber smell at the morning when the sun heats the curtains. Curtains not working well, needed to close manually/individually.

Reviews.Title: “They let my favorite hotel go downhill...what a shame.”
Reviews.Author: h4ppyc4mper
Reviews.Content: I just returned from my vacation so my observations are still fresh and clear. My husband and I stayed at Basico several years ago (maybe 2006?) when it had just opened and it made a lasting memory in our minds. It is a gorgeous hotel. Staying there made us feel 1000x cooler then we'll ever be and that pretty much summed it up for a review...then. Fast forward to today--The hotel is still gorgeous, the staff still looks like models and it still makes me feel well, maybe 100x cooler but my love of the hotel were quickly squashed when our toilet broke...and remained broke for the entirety or our stay. They tried to fix it with, get this, a trash bag drawstring. It immediately broke again. Go figure, a trash bag didn't work. So we had to improvise and use a coat hanger to operate the toilet from the inside of the tank. The bathtub was super cool and larger then most hot tubs. The downside was that the drain was about as good as the one at my house, i.e. clogged. The most disappointing thing about the room was that the sliding doors (the giant glass sliding door/walls) are all rotted, off the rails and unable to slide open anymore! This wasn't just our room (trust me we checked). That was one of the best features...an open room with an ocean breeze...no more. The worst part is the door frames have been painted over and the doors are permanently slightly open just enough to not block out any street sound. This is not an issue if you only want to sleep between 4am to 6am. The last two things I must mention is this; my reservation included a free breakfast and complementary waters. Upon check out I was charged $7 for the waters and $20 for the breakfast. You see, the food part was free...the girl putting the food on our table cost $20. (And to think we had tipped her big too...grr). And the waters...well, I guess they meant that the waters 'complemented' the rooms, not that they were 'complementary', our bad.

Reviews.Title: “best food in playa”
Reviews.Author: sippinonginandjuice
Reviews.Content: sure, it is a bit noisy if you come from the suburbs of Des Moines and are used to sleeping in dead silence. For those types of travelers I recommend Ice Fishing. But come on, it is a hip/fun town and this is a hip/fun hotel with the best food on the yucatan. I go often to Riviera Maya on business and I stay there just for the nice service, great breakfast, nice lunch/dinner, and smooth cocktail at night - that puts me to sleep at 11pm. honestly, great prices for great food. and the staff have a nice smile. If it were on the beach it would be the best place in playa.

Reviews.Title: “amazing!”
Reviews.Author: ag319
Reviews.Content: I loved every second of this trip to playa. The hotel was incredible, the staff was outstanding, food was amazing. When I would leave the hotel to check out the beach bars, restaurants, etc. nothing compared to the peaceful, beautiful, tranquil atmosphere at basico. As a young woman traveling alone I felt very safe. The staff made me feel like family, the town embraced me like a local. I had never been to Mexico before and knew very little about Playa Del Carmen. I picked the perfect hotel and loved the town. Now that I am married I cannot wait to return with my husband. I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “We'd stay again...awesome rooftop bar/lounge area.”
Reviews.Author: TripsAreFunYAY
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at Basico over the long weekend last February and have been meaning to write a review ever since. We loved the hotel. We’re 27 and 28 years old and I think it is probably best suited for people who are planning to go up to the roof for drinks at night or at least be out somewhere at night until at least around midnight. Otherwise I imagine falling asleep would be a bit of a challenge, because the music coming from the roof is right above you. Though when you’re up on the roof its awesome, very pretty view during the day looking over the water from the comfy lounge bed/seat things. We were there to hit the beach and go out at night, so it was perfect for us. We LOVED the bar on the roof and would go up there for an after the beach cocktail every day. Highly recommend the cucumber martini. We had no complaints at all about the staff and thought they were great. The design of the rooms was cool, as you’ll see from the pictures online. The blinds that cover the windows are made out of tire rubber, I will say black tire rubber might not be the best for keeping out the heat, but it wasn’t a bit deal. We’d definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “AVOID THIS HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: avoidbasico
Reviews.Content: My friends and I got our cell phones stolen inide our rooms, we placed a complaint and nobody cared. Avoid this hotel and all the other in the chain, not worth it...

Reviews.Title: “VERIFY YOUR BILLS . . . notorious for making numerous mistakes”
Reviews.Author: BLS_65
Reviews.Content: Hotel Basico & Hotel Deseo are owned by Grupo Habita. Both are trendy hip small hotels, so you shouldn't expect to get any sleep! Overall, the Hotel Basico & Hotel Deseo are (2) hotels where the DESIGN is their primary GOAL and all other factors of what make an acceptable hotel to stay are null, so don't expect competent service or quality food. VERIFY YOUR BILLS, since they are notorious for making numerous mistakes and covering up the 10% included tip with a thick black marker and then indicating by hand that the "tip is not included". We were foolish to eat here twice - Christmas and New Year's Eve ! Neither of these Hotels are located on the beach, but are within walking distance. These Hotels are located a few blocks apart centered on the busiest strip of Playa de Carmen.

Reviews.Title: “Takes some getting used to”
Reviews.Author: karmacowboy
Reviews.Content: A very fun, hip approach - the rooms are quite different. The real problem is the incredible noise at all times of the day and the throngs of charter tourists you will hit once you leave the building. Quaint it's not!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the design, environment, service”
Reviews.Author: karybird
Reviews.Content: Definitely not for everyone, but we LOVED the design of this hotel and totally enjoyed the upstairs bar and DJ. Our room had a balcony overlooking 5th Avenue, which was fun (but, yes, it's noisy all the way around). Great walking access to 5th Ave restaurants and bars and only a block from the beach. Borrow beach towels and get a pass for Mamita's beach club from the desk, otherwise you'll have to pay to rent a chair and towels...

Reviews.Title: “Cool design, great staff and great location!”
Reviews.Author: danawynne
Reviews.Content: After a rival hotel lost our reservation we found ourselves saved by Hotel Basico and most specifically it's manager Marianne, who after hearing our terrible story, upgraded us to the best room in the hotel--she truly saved our honeymoon! Marianne and the entire staff were incredibly helpful in making restaurant, nightlife and beach suggestions and really helped us get the most out of our experience. Despite what some reviewers say, we found the design to be hip, but still very comfortable and functional--and the blinds do close enough to provide privacy. There is a bit of street noise at night, but we personally, enjoyed the feeling of being in the midst of the buzz of the Playa nights--Nothing some earplugs and a couple tequila's couldn't fix! We couldn't say enough good things about the hotel and our experience, thank you Basico!

Reviews.Title: “Very cool just dont expect to sleep”
Reviews.Author: mberry121981
Reviews.Content: The place is very col in design. Despite what others said I found that the blinds were good enough for the privacy. The handcuffs and polarid cameras were a bit much but ok. The real problem was that we ended our honeymoon here after traveling around the Yucatan for 2 weeks. I think it would be best to start a vacation here rather then end it at Basico. The staff was very helpful and the bar food was great. The hotel rooftop bar was cool and the pool is a neat concept but not very functional when you had to share with some creepy Euro hipsters. The biggest problem comes if you want to sleep at all. The music I think started at 8:00 or 9:00 and does not stop until late. We were on the third floor right below the bar and it was in possible to sleep. Thinking that since we could not sleep we decided to join all of the fun upstairs at the bar only to find no one was there but the bartender. Very lame and annoying. I think that if you are looking to party this would be a great place to stay, I just hope you bring your own friends.

Reviews.Title: “Hip Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ARUBYSTAR
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed here for a few days on our honeymoon. We loved it!! My husband is a grapic desinger and he really liked the aesthetics of the hotel on a whole. I thought the room was neatly designed. Everything had it's place, very utilitarian.... and the bed was very comfortable. It was located right on the strip where the shops and restaurants are and the beach a block away! The best part of this hotel is the lounge/bar on the roof! You can take in some sun, food, drink, relaxation and there are 2 water tanks to dip in when you want to cool down! Friendly Helpful Staff! The best Martinis and Food! You almost don't need to leave the roof! Looking forward to going back!

Reviews.Title: “Designer chic but got no sleep!”
Reviews.Author: Iscaray
Reviews.Content: As my friend put it and I agree, "I don't need to look cool while I sleep!" Hotel Basico is just that. The music from the roof top bar seemed to go on all night and if it didn't, the noise from the street kept us up. The complimentary ear plugs were a kind gesture but didn't seem to help. Aside from the lack of natural light in the rooms, unless of course you're an exhibitionist; the underlit, green fluorescent tube lighting just isn't that flattering and certainly makes for a weird atmosphere. The staff were kind and the morning lattes were great but I will never stay here again or recommend this hotel to anyone! This hotel would be best suited towards single batchelors searching for an all night party vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Experience EVER”
Reviews.Author: WanderlustToronto
Reviews.Content: I booked the "Sea View" suite hoping that the 300 USD a night I spent would be worth it. Bottom line is this hotel is 100% about style and design and 0% about being a real hotel. Example, our room did NOT have a sea view and were told that upon arrival. In fact, there are no longer Sea View rooms. More like street view, where basically the entire street can see you through the poor excuse for curtains. Also, the toilet did not work and we asked for them to fix it. It was ultimately NEVER fixed despite mentioning it more than once. Unacceptable. Oh, air conditioning might have helped. Upon arrival we were told it did not work so they gave us fans... which is supposed to make us feel better? Lights in the room might be nice as well. The bed is under-lite to be cool i guess, but heaven forbid you need a ceiling light where the rubber tire is hanging (i'm serious). In the morning you are awaken as the temperature slowly rises to 120 degrees and the sun burns through your eyelids. However, that is a great time to take a cold shower because there was no hot water option when i stayed there. At night, the party is on, with the DJ blasting house music even if there is no one at the bar. They give you earplugs to compensate. If you have a toothbrush there is nowhere to put it, that apparently isn't a necessary design feature. Upon check out i was told that the "owner doesn't want to spend the money for maintenance." Staff are very nice except have absolutely no power to help you. This hotel was designed by a local that looks at Wallpaper magazine but has never been in an actual hotel room. Oh, if you go and the website and look at the beautiful hipsters that are supposed to be staying there, we were those are people, and we aren't coming back. I have never had a hotel bring up such feelings of hatred. They should just nuke the site from orbit. It is not a real hotel. The only redeeming quality were the fish tacos - best I ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Great location...but won't go back”
Reviews.Author: jp_brown
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went for a romantic getaway back to what had been one of our favortie places to visit, Playa. It had been 5 yrs since we had been to Playa and we are very disappointed that the commercialism of Cancun is quickly leaking into what used to be a chic setting with alot of charisma. We were even more disappointed to see the sleepy little beachside resorts being replaced everywhere with large condo complexes, we will probably never go back to Playa again for just those reasons. Back to Hotel Basico...we read as many reviews as we could on this place and were aware of the "pitfalls" before booking our stay. Ultimately the location and easy access to everything in Playa won out and we decided to stay there. The Hotel is very chic and sexy and the location couldn't be better if Playa was what Playa had managed to remain for so long. But still it is very convenient to walk right out onto 5th Ave. and immediately submerse yourself in the Carribean life. The rooms are very comfortable for a romantic getaway, somewhat small, but who really spends a whole lot of time in their rooms anyway? I do have to register a complaint about the big sliding doors in the room, ours at first didn't open, but they sent up maintenance to open it for us. We didn't really have a good view from the room we were in, but it was still nice to be able to open it and let the breeze in, though we most often used the AC, which worked very well in the room we had. If you are overly shy and private, the "blinds" don't really obscure all that much, but unless you are right in front of the window, you have decent privacy. The rooftop pool has nice vistas, but isn't really very functional. The beach club you have access to is very nice and we spent most of our days there, however, it is quite a walk to it, not that my wife and I mind the exercise, but it did get a little laborious about the 5th day. The music at night is loud, worse some nights than others, but we usually had little trouble sleeping through it. The hotel is veeeery gay friendly, so if that kind of thing bothers you, you might consider staying somewhere else. We are the kind of people that are live and let live, but I don't really care to see it in all its glory. All in all, the hotel is as described in the reviews on here so I can't really complain, because it is represented accurately. However, my wife and I have no intention of returning.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotels on three continents”
Reviews.Author: boroille
Reviews.Content: PIcture a hotel room in the middle of a throbbing night club and you've got Basico. This "hotel" is really a hipster night club with rooms just steps away from the dance floor. After we complained the first night, we were told the staff was surprised because we had the "quiet" room. It was indeed the farthest form the rooftop club... or about 40 feet. Even ear plugs didn't quite do it. We were told that "last night was a special party, tonight it stops at 2." Great! And pray your late afternoon rest before heading back out doesn't get ruined by a spring break-worthy "pool party" that'll make your bones rattle. Oh, and the curtain on the windows fell apart, the faucet was broken and the "safe" is a wooden box with a 50-cent lock. Did I mention no hot water? By FAR the worst hotel after extensive travels in North and South America and Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Hot, loud, but nice to look at.”
Reviews.Author: ushkush
Reviews.Content: After coming to Playa for almost ten years, I've stayed in many places and since Basico opened wanted to stay here, but they were always booked. I always travel last minute. This time they had a room for 3 nights so I was thrilled to book it. When I arrived the service was mexcellent as expected. The room how ever had it's problems. There was no polaroid camera as touted everywhere and no rocker as seen in every picture (no big deal). Where they killed me was that the window did not open and the gigantic tub must be filled with the shower head, thus tepid at best once filled. I politely complained about the window, one of the big draws for me. Some people don't like such exposure, but I love the caribbean breeze. When you have a window you don't need aircon. They told me it was because of the hurricanes and it was dangerous to open them. This is utter crap. The other room had their windows open and all the other hotels also. Evvn with the aircon on it was stifling hot. Also the thumping from the roofdeck is unbearable and I like to party. The style is awesome and they make great use of recycled and sustainable materials. The staff are otherwise accommodating, extremely friendly yet not Playa insiders. The roof deck during the day is a quiet respite from the throngs down below and they have free highspeed WiFi.

Reviews.Title: “Loudest Hotel in Playa”
Reviews.Author: littlemisskristin
Reviews.Content: The only redeeming quality of this hotel was the huge comfortable king size bed...unfortunately the music coming from the rooftop bar and club was so deafeningly loud that it made it impossible to sleep even with earplugs and a pillow over your head. It sounded like the party was in our room from about 6pm to 4am. The worst part was, I stopped to look at this hotel (before 6pm) prior to booking a room and the staff assured me that it was very quiet because the bar was on the roof. This was a blatant lie. Don't stay here unless you plan on partying all night long and sleeping during the day.

Reviews.Title: “Hit the Spot”
Reviews.Author: ajmfoto
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our honeymoon and researched it before going. It was exactly how it was described. You do hear some techno music coming from the bar on the top level, but nothing you can't sleep through- unless you need complete silence. The place is basic (as the name implies) and we loved it for that. You have a bed and some stools in your room so if you are looking to lounge around, besides the bed, there are spots outside- not as private, but often times we had the whole top, bar area, to ourselves during the day. I would stay here again. Food was great- we walked out our door and ate lunch at the little restaurant in the hotel. The staff was friendly and cool at every interaction. We stayed during the rainy season and it rained almost everyday, but we got our share of sun in between the storms.

Reviews.Title: “More art / design than hotel”
Reviews.Author: FernandoSaoPaulo
Reviews.Content: Was planning to spend a couple of nights at hotel basico, but the first night made us check out the next morning. + Design / materials: The design and materials used are very interesting. From an architechtural point of view it is an interesting object. - Comfort: Comfort equals zero. The hotel was built for the design and not for being a hotel. On the negative side: it is extremely loud in the rooms (very badly accustic isolation, disco music at night, very loud street in the morning) and very little privacy (huge windows with very bad curtains with the result that one does not feel private in the room; much like an acquarium). There are much better options in the area in Tulum beach (nice cabanas hotel with the same ammenities right on the beach).

Reviews.Title: “Prefer bedroom not to be bathroom”
Reviews.Author: ward11
Reviews.Content: Great location in a town that is losing its charm. Roof deck is fabulous - great food, view and people. Rooms are too hip for their own good. I am not one to prefer having your bathroom and bedroom in the same place, and so this place got on my nerves from the outset. The blinds/shades that separate your bed from the restaurnt tables a few feet away do not really provide 100% privacy (ok, they don't provide 80% privacy). The shower, despite it's location next to the bed, has fantastic water pressure. If I go back to Playa, probably will look for somewhere else to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Be cool!”
Reviews.Author: bababie
Reviews.Content: My partner treated me to 3 nights at this hotel over Christmas. He booked directly with them and was given a rate for the room. CHECK-IN: When we arrived and checked in, there was some confusion about the price of the room and a higher rate was quoted to my partner. After pointing out that he had received a lower rate confirmed by email, the original quoted price was reconfirmed. Hopefully this was just an innocent mistake... Watch out for the fact that the initial prices don't include VAT OR local taxes though! (This is stated on the hotel's website). Check-in is from 3pm - we arrived a couple of hours early and they said they would have our room prepared within about an hour and we could leave our bags with them, so we took a walk down to the beach nearby. HOTEL - General: The Basico is a design-conscious hotel for the young and trendy. The fittings and furnishings are mostly made from recycled objects. The rooftop has a bar, comfortable 'beds' to lounge on, and two small pools in the form of large vats. Very cool. Surely the location of many a fashion photo shoot. At night there was music on the rooftop, and we could definitely hear it quite clearly from the room we were in, though being heavy sleepers this didn't bother us too much. There is a restaurant at the hotel and breakfast is available (surcharge) - we didn't eat there so I can't comment on the food. The staff were generally friendly, and young and trendy like most of the other guests! According to the hotel website children are not allowed. ROOM: The room was one of the 'patio view' ones. It was interestingly decorated - slightly 'clinical', but with a few quirky touches (flippers under the bed, a Polaroid camera chained to the bed - film for it was available in the room at an extra cost). The bed was metal-framed and quite high up - I felt like I was on some kind of (admittedly comfortable!) operating table!! There was a mirrored wall behind a set of hand-basins, the exposed pipes serving as towel rails. What with the Polaroid, the operating table bed, the mirrored wall, and a fluorescent light, it seemed like the set of some kind of porn movie! The room was accessed by a sliding glass door, and the rest of this wall of the room is also glass. There were rubber strips which form curtains on this window-wall, but, as mentioned by another reviewer, you feel quite exposed to the view of people walking past because the 'curtains' are just a number of strips. We could see into our neighbour's room when she had the curtains 'closed'. The toilet was in a small cubicle on one side of the room, and the shower on the other side of the room. It consisted of a large shower head over a square, high-sided tub - not your average bathtub or shower, but it had good water pressure! There were shampoo and conditioner provided in quirky, ketchup-style bottles, and a bar of soap. There was a small amount of hanging space, one drawer and a useful pull-out stand under the bed for luggage. Other room details: * TV with DVD * Stocked mini bar (prices are provided in the room) * Telephone * Wireless internet connection * Air conditioning * No hairdryer or safety deposit box in the room itself, though these might be available if you ask at the front desk. * Water - In some hotels in Mexico we've noticed that drinking water is provided, since drinking the tap water is not recommended. There was a glass bottle of water in the room, but it came with a price tag of $50 Mexican pesos! (approx. USD $4.50/ 3 euro) * There was also a small container with cotton wool and cotton buds - with a price tag of $250 Mexican pesos!! (approx. USD $22 or 15 euro) - that HAD to be a misprint, but we didn't use them just in case!! These are nice touches, but not when they come with a price tag - in a hotel of this price range we would expect that if such items are left in the room at all, then they are for the guest's use free of charge. * A note for anyone with reduced mobility:* The pool requires climbing a few steps to get in. There IS a lift in the hotel. The shower/bath and bed in our room would not be easy to get in and out of - check if there are other rooms which are more suitable.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay”
Reviews.Author: dave471
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I stayed here over Thanksgiving for 5 nights. We had an incredible time. It was actually quiet, contrary to what others have said here. It may have been due to the holiday, who knows. The room was what we expected and the one thing I would have added is more drawers for your clothes. The restaurant was very good. We had the fres catch and it was excellent. The staff was very attentive and friendly as well. Eat at the noodle bar across the street and have drinks at the ula gula bar. Great food and we loved the staff at the ula gula bar on the corner. We walked to mamitas beach every day. The beach is great with a good staff serving snacks and drinks while sunbathing on a queen bed. It was a young and fun crowd at the beach. It reminded me of South Beach a little. Great scenery. Photos enclosed.

Reviews.Title: “The Most Beautiful Hotel, With The Most Lovely Staff”
Reviews.Author: Nounou
Reviews.Content: We did a road trip from Mexico City down to Playa del Carmen & back up again. We had a very long journey & had driven through the night which had rather disorientated us, & when we arrived at Basico they couldn't find our reservation, this was through no fault of theirs. It was ours, we accidentally arrived a day early! This was not a problem & they showed us to our room. Firstly let me say, you will not be dissapointed with the appearance of this hotel, it looks exactly as it does on the website & is very well maintained - everything looks brand new. Our room looked onto the courtyard, the bed is elevated & super comfy, there is a big book for you to draw & scribble in & look at other peoples drawings & scribbles, they even supply a polaroid camera for which you can buy film (also in the room). A sink each, huge bath, separate toilet cubicle complete with disco ball light pully. It even has one of the 'libre' (free) signs from the Mexican taxi's in the window, which you flip down when you go out so they can come & clean your room. The roof terrace did not dissapoint, with the big round tanker/pool & the bar staff are lovely & the cocktails are fab & really not that expensive at all. They also do food, we had a few snacky things, which were delish.. They have a little area in the reception where they sell cool little bits & pieces. They are incredibly helpful here & for such a hip hotel, the staff are not pretentious or snotty in any way at all. They make an effort to remember who you are & one day when my partner went to the terrace without me, they asked where I was... This is quite a 'party' hotel, so if you want quiet early nights - forget it, lots of people seemed to be coming to the hotel in the evenings to go to the terrace to have cocktails & listen to the dj - who plays most nights, plays late. This has now taken over from the Hudson (NYC) as the coolest hotel I have ever stayed in. It was the full package, it was unsual, beautiful, well maintained, excellent value for money & the service was absolutely faultless. This was the first time in my life where I would have been quite happy just to be in the hotel all day. I would highly recommend this hotel, the designer is brilliant & I hope whoever it is designs lots more because I will stay at them all. THANK YOU BASICO x

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Basico, will you marry me?”
Reviews.Author: xpudoo-chump
Reviews.Content: First, it's sustainable, mostly. Super cool. For example, the floors in the "lobby" and blinds in the rooms are made from tires; the shampoo and conditioner are in refillable containers and a whole bunch of other clever green touches. Good job. Second, nearly everyone who works there is hot. Seriously. It's kinda ridiculous. Third, the hospitality is amazing. The concierge, who worked tirelessly to find me a temascal (because it just wasn't hot *enough* in Mexico) said in the cutest way possible upon my thanking him for all of his help: "Oh, it is not a problem. Ees my yob." So, those are the important things... I highly recommend it. Though, if you're going for a quiet vacation, it's prob not the best spot since the dj spins til about 1 every night and the music starts again at 9. And if it's not music, well, we also had a string of neighbors who HAVEN'T YET HEARD that sleep is the new sex.

Reviews.Title: “Basico - for better or worse, the name says it all...”
Reviews.Author: texmel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, freshly married, checked into the Hotel Basico for several nights in April. Having visited Playa del Carmen a year before, we were eager to try this new "darling" on the designer/boutique hotel circuit. Despite some true design ingenuity (saw handles as bathroom door knobs, under bed sliding suitcase drawers), the hotel room was VERY basic (nowhere to sit other than the bed (or the toilet, i guess) with limited hot water. Our front door lock was also jammed for the first half of our stay, literally requiring us to have housekeeping let us into our room, and lock it after us, every time we came and went. My recommendation? Come for a drink on the roof deck, as it really does have a great perspective not seen elsewhere in Playa hotels, but for the money, there are so many better (and quieter options), once the gimmick wears off.
